q2.description: $\textbf {Definition}$: A set is $\textbf {closed}$ over a (binary) operation if, whenever that operation is applied to any two members of the set, the result is a member of the set.
q2.question: Suppose $L = \{x \ | \ x \ is \ a \ positive \ even \ integer\}$. What is the result of adding two positve even numbers?

q3.description: $\textbf {Definition}$: A set is $\textbf {closed}$ over a (binary) operation if, whenever that operation is applied to any two members of the set, the result is a member of the set.
q3.question: So, is $L$ closed under addition?

q6.description: $\textbf {Definition}$: A set is $\textbf {closed}$ over a (binary) operation if, whenever that operation is applied to any two members of the set, the result is a member of the set.
q6.question:
Suppose $L = \{x \ | \ x \ is \ a \ positive \ even \ integer\}$. What is the result of subtracting two numbers in $L$?
For example 4 - 6
